string-array.name: notification_channel_desc_list
string-array.item: Alert if covid is rising nearby

resources.string: There is %d new cases in %s, %d new cases in %s and %d new cases in %s. Be safe, be smart, be kind \uD83D\uDE37
There is %d new cases in %s. Be safe, be smart, be kind \uD83D\uDE37
We get our data from covid19india.org

This app helps you to track Covid19 in indian and it\'s different states and districts. This app will give you report daily about covid cases in your nearby area.
This app will tell you different way to prevent from covid and if unfortunately if you got covid, it will tell you different ways to cure.

The suggestion and guidelines is taken from Health Ministry, Government of India
There is also a section to buy essential things if required from the comfort of your home.

Track Covid19 case in the india and stay updated. Buy essentials from home. Get Daily Report about covid cases in your area. Different ways to prevent and cure covid from official sources of Health Ministry, Government of India 

Download %s
 %s

string-array.name: q_and_a_questions_list
string-array.item: What are covid19india.org sources? How is the data gathered for this project?
Why does covid19india.org have difference in numbers compared to MOHFW website?
Where can I find the data for this?
Why are covid19india.org guys putting in time and resources to do this while not gaining a single penny from it?
Is this official app of covid19india.org

string-array.name: q_and_a_answers_list
string-array.item: covid19india.org is using state bulletins and official handles to update our numbers. The data is validated by a group of volunteers and published into a Google sheet and an API. API is available for all at data.covid19india.org. We would love it if you can use this data in the fight against this virus. The source list is here(https://telegra.ph/Covid-19-Sources-03-19).

MoHFW updates the data at a scheduled time. However, covid19india.org updates them based on state press bulletins, official (CM, Health M) handles, PBI, Press Trust of India, ANI reports. These are generally more recent.
All the data is available through an API for further analysis and development here : data.covid19india.org

covid19india.org are a group of dedicated volunteers who curate and verify the data coming from several sources. covid19india.org extracts the details, like a patient\'s relationship with other patients to identify local and community transmissions, travel history and status. covid19india.org never collects or expose any personally identifiable data regarding the patients.

Because it affects all of us. Today it\'s someone else who is getting infected; tomorrow it could be us. We need to prevent the spread of this virus. We need to document the data so that people with knowledge can use this data to make informed decisions.
No, this app is only using it\'s api (data.covid19india.org)

resources.string: Get report about Covid cases in your area
Something Went Wrong while processing your request
NO app is not installed to handle this request
-- Below Information will help us to give you better support. --
Reach out to developer via email
We have a new app update, please update you app.
We have a critical app update, please update you app.
Wash your hands often with Soap and Water
Scrub for at least 20 seconds. If Soap and Water are not available, use an Alcohol-Based Sanitizer.
Avoid Close Contact with people who are sick
A person with Coronavirus can spread it to others who are up to about 6 feet away.
Clean and Disinfect commonly used surfaces
Wipe Down door knobs, tables, light switches, keyboards, and remote controls.
Don’t touch your eyes, nose or mouth
A virus can enter your body this way.
Cover your nose and mouth with a mask when around others
This helps reduce the risk of spread both by close contact and by airborne transmission.
Stay home if you are sick
If you have coronavirus symptoms, stay home except to get medical care.
Be in Touch with treating physician
Continue the medications for other comorbid illness after consulting the physician
Perform warm water gargles or take steam inhalation twice a day
If you find Difficulty in breathing
Dip in oxygen saturation (SpO2 < 94% on room air)
Mental confusion or inability to arouse
